alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 2:46AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Crockett County through 345 AM CDT... At 246 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Ft Lancaster, or 17 miles southeast of Sheffield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ft Lancaster, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290 and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 332 and 362. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for west central Texas.
